document.heading: Pedestrian Safety Enforcement Amendment Act of 2008

history.narrative: Law 17-269, the “Pedestrian Safety Enforcement Amendment Act of 2008”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-539 which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 15, 2008, and September 16, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on September 30, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-522 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-269 became effective on November 25, 2008.
